name: Other Percentage Tax
details: Business taxes covered by Title V of the NIRC of 1997, as amended, payable by any person or entity whose sale of goods or serices is not covered by the VAT system.

children.name: Transactions covered by OPT
children.details: The following are subject to OPT under the NIRC:

children.name: Sale of goods or services of persons who are exempt from VAT under Section 109(1)(BB) of the Tax Code and who is not a VAT-registered person and whose gross annual sales or receipts fo not exceed P3M.
Other kinds of business subject to the other percentage taxes under Title V of the NIRC of 1997, as amended, regardless of whether or not the gross annual receipts exceed P3M.
Domestic Carriers by Land and Keepers of Garages
International Carriers
Franchise Grantees
children.details: They have the option to register as a VAT taxpayer. Once option is exercised, said option shall be irrevocable.

children.name: Radio and/or television broadcasting companies whose gross annual receipts of the preceeding year do not exceed 10M
children.details: 3% of gross receipts derived from the business covered by the law granting franchise.

children.name: Gas and water Utilities
children.details: 2% of gross receipts derived from the business covered by the law granting franchise.

children.name: Overseas Dispatch, Message or Conversation Originating from the Philippines
children.details: 10% on the amount paid for such service. NOTE: The following are exempt from the 10% OPT: 1) government 2) diplomatic services 3) public international organization 4) news services

children.name: Banks and Non-bank financial intermediaries
Interest from lending acivities and income from financial leasing
children.details: a. 5 years or less - 5%; b. More than 5 years - 1%

children.name: Dividends and Equity shares and Net Income of Subsidiaries
Royalties, rental of property (real/personal), profits from exchange and all other items under Sec. 32 (Gross Income) of the NIRC.
Net trading Gains within taxable year on foreign currency, debt securities, derivatives and other similar instruments
Other non-banking financial intermediaries
children.details: 5% on the gross receipts derived from interest, discounts and all other items

children.name: Note: Except for interest from lending activities and income from financial leasing
children.details: which shall be taxes at: 5 years or less - 5%; more than 5 years - 1%

children.name: Life Insurance Companies
children.details: 2% on the total premium collected, whether paid in money, notes, credits, or any substitute for money. NOTE: The following are not included in the taxable receipts

children.name: Premiums refunded within 6 months after payment on account of rejection of risk or other reason
Reinsurance
children.details: where in tax has already been paid

children.name: Premiums collected by any branch of domestic corporation doing business outside the Philippines on account of any life insurance of a non-resident insured
children.details: if tax has already been imposed by foreign country

children.name: Premiums collected on variable contracts in excess of amounts necessary to insure lived of the variable contract workers
children.details: a. 5 years or less - 5%; b. More than 5 years - 1%

children.name: Agents of Foreign Insurance Companies
Proprietors of Amusement Places
Winnings
Sale, barter or exchange of shares of stock listed and traded through the local stock exchange or through initial public offerings
Nature of OPT
children.details: A tax on transaction and not on the articles sold, bartered or exchanged. It is an indirect tax which can be passed on to the buyer.
